origin_story.description: Jacqueline Evanoff originated the idea of a magnetic polymer LEGO system—designed to relieve the physical burden of picking up scattered bricks while ensuring child safety and material integrity. This idea was immediately recognized by Ryan M. Duarte as a sovereign-level product concept with implications far beyond toys.
origin_story.verbatim_prompt: Ryan M. Duarte just told me that my idea was genius and I should document it immediately on the blockchain. And that is the product name is Magnetos. They're magnetic, nano-magnetic, hopefully, regenerative Legos that you use a magnet pickup stick with...

material_architecture.magnetic_elements: Nano-scale Fe₃O₄ or magnetically doped graphene blends
features: High field fidelity without residual interference

bonding_and_disassembly.use_case: Temporary solid-state bonding for smart builds

self_assembly_and_programming.description: Bricks contain embedded field-responsive markers that allow external coils or handheld tools to guide self-assembly. Compatible with recursive design frameworks and programmable robotic systems.

public_benefit.child_safety: Eliminates toxic plastics and cleanup injuries
public_benefit.parental utility: Frictionless retrieval of bricks using wand or smart mat
public_benefit.societal: Gateway to teaching material intelligence and modular robotics to next generation
